Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; part of band of downward rays in added white above white and added red bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of boar (part of back with red dots and crest remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The exterior and interior surfaces of the sherd are burnt from the bombings in London in 1941 during WWII.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1594) (phase 2)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: ucl np 56 (Other Accession Number)
